title: Volvo CE launches electric loader conversion - electrive.com - www.electrive.com
summary: Volvo Construction Equipment (Volvo CE) is expanding its electric vehicle offerings with the L120H Electric Conversion, a retrofitted 20-ton loader. This conversion, developed in partnership with CE Engineering Solutions and Parker Hannifin, features 240 kWh batteries providing up to five hours of runtime and a quick charging time.  Volvo CE is committed to carbon neutrality by 2040 and aims to have 35% of its machines electric by 2030, pursuing both retrofit and dedicated EV solutions to meet these goals.

title: Putting hydrogen to work on industrial heating | Imperial News - Imperial College London
summary: H2GO Power, a hydrogen energy startup, has partnered with Baxi to develop systems that use hydrogen to decarbonize industrial heating processes. The first application will be using hydrogen to pre-heat natural gas before it enters the distribution system, without creating greenhouse gases. This partnership aims to bring climate-neutral heating to a wide range of industrial applications, potentially impacting sectors like cement, glass, ceramics, chemicals, food and drink, and paper and pulp.
